    • Constructor Detail

      • War

        public War()
        This constructor creates a game of War. It first creates a new deck and two ArrayLists to hold the cards on the field. It then splits the deck in half and assigns one half to player 1's hand, and the other to player 2.

    • Method Detail

      • battle

        public void battle()
        The battle method simulates a battle of cards in the game of War. It first calls the flipTop method to remove a card from each hand, then adds them to the ArrayLists of cards on the field. It them compares them based on rank and adds them to the winning player's hand. If there is a War, the cards are not added and are kept to compare in the War.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - When there is an error with the indexes of the hands or the ArrayLists of cards on the field.
        Exception - If any critical error or otherwise should occur.

      • war

        public void war()
        The war method simulates a "war" when the two player's cards have equal ranks. It first "flips" two more cards off of each hand, one face down, then compares the face-up cards; the player with the higher rank gets all the cards, including the ones that triggered the war. If there is another tie, sets playerWins to 3 to show that there is another war.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - When there is an error with the indexes of the hands or the ArrayLists of cards on the field.
        Exception - If any critical error or otherwise should occur.

      • getPlayerWins

        public int getPlayerWins()
        The getPlayerWins method returns an integer to represent which player won. If it is 3, it means there was a tie.
        Returns:
        The integer representing which player won.

      • getWarWinner

        public int getWarWinner()
        The getWarWinner method compares the number of cards in a player's hand. If either has 0, declares them the winner. If both are 0, there is a tie. The method then returns the number of the player who won, or 3 if there is a tie.
        Returns:
        The number of the player who won.

      • clearSpoils

        public void clearSpoils()
        The clearSpoils method clears the cards from the ArrayLists representing the cards on the field.

      • clearHands

        public void clearHands()
        The clearHands method clears all the cards from both player's hands.

      • getSpoilsP1

        public ArrayList<Card> getSpoilsP1()
        The getSpoilsP1 method returns the cards belonging to player 1 that are on the field.
        Returns:
        The ArrayList of cards on the field belonging to player 1.

      • getSpoilsP2

        public ArrayList<Card> getSpoilsP2()
        The getSpoilsP2 method returns the cards belonging to player 2 that are on the field.
        Returns:
        The ArrayList of cards on the field belonging to player2.

      • getCardsP1

        public int getCardsP1()
        The getCardsP1 method returns the number of cards in player 1's hand.
        Returns:
        The number of cards in player 1's hand.

      • getCardsP2

        public int getCardsP2()
        The getCardsP2 method returns the number of cards in player 2's hand.
        Returns:
        The number of cards in player 2's hand.

      • findFaceDownCard

        public int findFaceDownCard(ArrayList<Card> cards)
        The findFaceUpCard method accepts an ArrayList of Card objects passed in as an argument. It then performs a selection search to find each face-down card in the ArrayList and returns an ArrayList of integers containing the index of each one.
        Returns:
        The ArrayList containing the indexes of each face-down card.

      • getTurns

        public int getTurns()
        The getTurns method returns the number of turns that have passed.
        Returns:
        The current number of turns.
